column1: People born with abnormal bones in their feet are more likely to form a bunion.
- Wear felt or foam pads on your foot to protect the bunion, or devices called spacers to separate the first and second toes.
Surgery reduces the pain in many, but not all, people with bunions.

Call your doctor if the bunion: - Continues to cause pain even after self-care, such as wearing wide-toed shoes - Prevents you from doing your usual activities - Has any signs of infection (like redness or swelling), especially if you have diabetes
